Class FilterApplication

java.lang.Object
ch.supsi.application.filters.FilterApplication
public class FilterApplication extends Object
The FilterApplication class provides functionalities for managing and applying filters to images. It serves as an interface for interacting with the filter pipeline, allowing filters to be added, removed, and processed, while updating the application state.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static FilterApplication getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the FilterApplication.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the FilterApplication.

    • getAllAvailableFilters

      public List<String> getAllAvailableFilters()
      Retrieves a list of all available filters.
      Returns:
      a read-only List of all available filter names.

    • addFilterToPipeline

      public void addFilterToPipeline(String filterName)
      Adds a filter to the filter pipeline by its name.
      Parameters:
      filterName - the name of the filter to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the filterName does not correspond to a valid filter.

    • processFilterPipeline

      public void processFilterPipeline(WritableImage image)
      Processes the filter pipeline on the given image.
      Parameters:
      image - the image to apply the filters on.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the filter pipeline is empty or cannot be processed.

    • add

      public void add(String filterName, int index)
      Adds a filter to a specific index in the filter pipeline.
      Parameters:
      filterName - the name of the filter to add.
      index - the position in the pipeline where the filter should be added.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.

    • remove

      public String remove(int index)
      Removes a filter from the filter pipeline at a specific index.
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the filter to remove.
      Returns:
      the name of the removed filter.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.
